title: Getting an S
body:
So I'm playing as sejuani jungle and I can't get an S anymore. 
I did the most damage in my team and went 8/1/18 with 147 C's at 38:31mins. And I get an A+
Or am I doing something wrong. Help

replies.body:
To get an S, you have to get into the top percentile for your champion in your role at your mmr and if you get an S, chances are, your mmr will increase making it more difficult to get the next one. 
I'm not sure about this one but I think it's also harder to get a higher rank as your mastery with the champion increases.

The easiest way is to just play champs in unconventional roles like if you went 8/1/18 with 147 C's at 38:31mins with sejuani mid-lane, you'd probably get an S

Getting as S has little to do with KDA really. It's about doing the right things in the game.  My last S was on Sivir and I scored 7/7/12. The reason I got an S though was because I recognized our win condition and implemented it. We were getting smashed in the team fight, but I had Sivir so I knew I had some split push potential. I implemented that strategy and every time somebody came to lane to push back I used my Ult to disengage, which let the rest of the team keep control of the other lanes. We eventually had the momentum and the other team finally made a mistake and sent Oriana on her own 3 levels behind me by this stage to stop the push (instaed of the usual 2 or 3), so at that point Ii decided to 1v1 her and take her out and from there we were able to take out inbhbitors and win the game.

I think it's about how much damage you have done in total and how you carry your team. When I receive the most kills I don't get and S but when I carried my team and was the only one not feeding I got an S but we still lost. It's also about the people you play with. Pretend someone on the enemy team is queueing with a beginner and he feeds you kills or even if the enemy team has a feeder, you may think by the amount of kills you have got from him/her will give you an S but I'm pretty sure that Riot has something that can detect that.
